pros: great work environment and education great benefits and fair wage flexible
cons: none observed while working there

job_title: Student Center operations assistant in California, PA
pros: I learned cash handling, people, and building management skills.
cons: Lack of communication between different departments within the building. Difficult system to add money to student accounts.

job_title: Assistant Director, Financial Aid in California, PA
pros: Nice people, good hours, good benefits
cons: Low salary, tough field, political to get promoted

job_title: Work Study Student in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Nice work life balance there.
cons: The pay is absolutely terrible.

review_title: Good place to start career; Unsure about the long-term health of Cal U
pros: Wonderful people, engaged students, fair salary with time to work on research
cons: Integration under the guise of savings; Unsure what it will accomplish other than securing the death knell of Cal U as we know it

pros: Great work environment and bosses
cons: I enjoyed my time as a student ambassador.

review_title: Cal U of PA Graduate Admissions
job_title: Student Recruitment Advisor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
Excellent Benefits, 
Quality Graduate Degrees and Certificate programs
cons: Currently going through Integration of 3 schools in PASSHE system. Jobs assignments and leadership in transition

pros: Good salary and benefits very well taken care of. Nice campus. Will probably not stay this way though. The whole system is in a spiral.
cons: Workload, political climate need attention to be sure. Need more Competent staff. It’s a bad scene. Very very very very bad

job_title: Student Note Taker in California, PA
pros: Pretty basic job - take notes in class and type them up for a student with disabilities. No interview, so it was a pretty immediate hiring process. They back pay you for the notes you took in previous classes, before you were hired. Really nice people to work with.
cons: Only get paid for the amount of time you're in class, not the amount of time it takes to type up the notes. No benefits. Minimum wage. You also don't get paid for doing all the training.

job_title: Assistant Business Professor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great facilities for the price
cons: Not nationally known and name can be confusing.

job_title: Residence Hall Director in California, PA
pros: Great salary and great benefits
cons: Politics, bullying, lack of leadership and structure

pros: Faculty supportive of each other, good union representation
cons: Many students are often ill-prepared for college level work

pros: Great learning environment with people who care about you.
cons: Hours can vary but they’re always willing to help you.

review_title: CalU is a great place to get an education and work at the same time.
pros: CalU is a great place to work while going to school at the same time.  Many student are commuters and work various jobs as university employees to help pay for their education, such as being a notetaker for students with disabilities.  You can actually get paid to take your own notes while helping another student succeed in learning. Professors are also helpful with recommending assitantships as another means of income.
cons: The assistantships are mainly part-time with varying hours that sometimes interfere with class schedules.

review_title: Great working environment, but many institutional challenges
pros: Positive, friendly work environment. Faculty and management are very down to earth for the most part. Good benefits and flexibility. You look forward to going to work every day. Unionized work environment.
cons: Being a state school, Cal U is suffering from budget cuts. There is a lot of administrative upheaval. Depending on where you work, there is instability. The pay rate for many positions is not competitive.

pros: The pros really outweigh the cons. With twenty hour work weeks, and the opportunity to pay off your education with your earnings, working as a graduate assistant is a great job and Cal-U is a great university for work for
cons: There are really no cons of working as a graduate assistant. My biggest con, if I had to choose one, would be that you're limited from furthering your contract after graduation

review_title: California University of Pennsylvania focuses too much on sports and not enough where it counts.
pros: If you have a job here, there is not much pressure at all.  Everyone is very friendly and helpful.
cons: There are not enough details shared about projects, making it difficult to interpret and carry out.

review_title: Not A Lot Of Room For Growth
pros: Great work environment, friendly staff, safe environment, unionized
cons: State budget cuts, no mobility, you have to pay for parking

pros: The people that I'm working with are so nice and helpful.
cons: The only thing that I can think of is even though I learned a lot about project management, data management, and leadership, the department i was working for was not directly relevant to my major.

pros: Great working environment, friendly and helpful faculty staff. 20 hours of work per week helps you a lot to pay your tuition.
cons: Nothing important on negative side.

review_title: Great place to study and work
pros: Best academic environment with great people and staff
cons: far away from the city or any other organization

pros:
Clear guidelines and expectations.
Easy work.
cons:
Negotiating hours to work.
Lack of communication among department.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in California, PA
pros: Easy work,  nice as a work study to be on campus.
cons: Not much pay, not enough hours offered as a student.

pros: Management gives great training and support.
cons: The position was only temporary.

pros: Flexible Schedule, management is relaxed
cons: Other employees lack motivation, which makes you lose yours as well

pros: Transparent hiring and employee policies. Strong union. Reasonably small school.
cons: The administration. No clear direction for the future.
